definition: to (a place)/until (a time)/up to/to go/to arrive/(verb complement denoting completion or result of an action)

sentences.english: Who could have predicted that within ten years hed be in charge of the whole company?
sentences.chinese: 誰曾能預料到在十年內他會成爲整個公司的負責人？

sentences.english: How was I supposed to know that the one twin would break it with his head?
sentences.chinese: 我怎能料到雙胞胎中的一個會用頭把他弄碎呢？

sentences.english: He has never expected a touch to be so mysteriously arousing.
sentences.chinese: 他從沒料到一個觸碰能這般神祕地激起內心的激情。

sentences.english: Yet it has generated entirely unanticipated social and business behavior.
sentences.chinese: 但是它產生了完全不曾預料到的社會和業務行爲。

sentences.english: But what I didn't expect, were all of the small revelations sprinkled throughout.
sentences.chinese: 但是這個過程中貫穿的小發現卻是我所沒有預料到的。

sentences.english: In anticipation of bad weather they took plenty of warm clothes.
sentences.chinese: 他們預料到會變天而帶了很多厚衣服。

sentences.english: Apparently, Gong didn’t expect the song to become a hit.
sentences.chinese: 顯然，龔麗娜並未料到這首歌會這麼火。

sentences.english: Nobody expected a respectable 65 year-old man to be a killer.
sentences.chinese: 誰能料到一個可敬的65歲老人會是殺人兇手。

sentences.english: So you have to drive carefully and expect delays, you know.
sentences.chinese: 所以你要小心開車，要預料到時間會延誤，你知道。

sentences.english: In the course of the adjustment some problems which were unexpected before the design are descovered and solved.
sentences.chinese: 在調試過程中，對設計前未意料到的問題進行了處理。

sentences.english: Who knows how fast we shall be traveling in the year 2000?
sentences.chinese: 誰能料到2000年人的旅行速度會有多快？
發生了沒有意料到的事情。

sentences.english: Andrea didn't expect to see Steve on the street.
sentences.chinese: 安卓雅沒料到會在街上看到史提夫。

sentences.english: There, at Vyborg, we also had an unpleasant incident.
sentences.chinese: 當然我們在維堡也遭遇了一次未曾預料到的事故。

sentences.english: They didn't think the meeting would be put off.
sentences.chinese: 他們沒料到會議會被推遲。

definition: to expect/to presume/to think (sth is likely)
unexpected/hard to imagine/it had not occurred to me/who could have thought that
due to/to stem from/to go beyond (also fig. beyond reason, expectations etc)/to go against (expectations)
who would have thought that/who would have expected that
were it not for/if not for
to sense/to perceive/to become aware of/to detect
who would have thought that/who would have expected that
